author: Special Correspondent
text:
Moments after the Election Commission announced the date for the Assembly poll in Tamil Nadu, revenue officials forming part of the Flying Squad and Static Surveillance Teams carried out checks in different places in the district on Friday to enforce the Model Code of Conduct (MCC).

Police personnel also formed part of the Flying Squads and Static Surveillance Teams which carried out checks from the time the announcement for the election was made. The vehicle checks carried out by different teams of officials were videographed, official sources said. The Static Surveillance Teams would carry out checks at a particular spot, while the Flying Squad would be on the move.

Collector K.S. Palanisamy told ‘The Hindu’ that a meeting was conducted with all Returning Officers, Commissioner of Police, Superintendent of Police and senior officials of local bodies on Friday consequent to the announcement of the election date.

The need to enforce model code of conduct in Tiruchi district was driven home to officials at the meeting, Mr. Palanisamy said. Unauthorised hoardings would be removed and wall writings would be erased, he added.
title: Checks begin in Tiruchi
